meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the earth or soil.
meanings.sent1: The earthy smell of the garden after the rain was comforting.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's hands were always earthy from working in the fields.
meanings.sent3: The earthy potatoes seemed to whisper stories of the soil they came from.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings had an earthy quality, as if the colors were dug straight from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The earthy tones of the landscape painting made it feel like you could step right into it.

meanings.sent1: She had an earthy wisdom that came from years of experience.
meanings.sent2: His earthy advice cut through all the confusion and made everything clear.
meanings.sent3: The earthy approach to problem-solving involved a lot of common sense and a touch of humor.
meanings.sent4: Her earthy humor always brought a smile to everyone's face, even on the gloomiest days.
meanings.sent5: The earthy simplicity of his words made them resonate with truth and sincerity.

meanings.definition: Coarse or unrefined in taste or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The soup had an earthy flavor that reminded him of his grandmother's cooking.
meanings.sent2: Her earthy manners sometimes shocked the more refined guests at the party.
meanings.sent3: The earthy jokes at the comedy club made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His earthy language might not be polite, but it always got his point across.
meanings.sent5: The earthy dance moves were a refreshing change from the usual polished routines.
